classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, B3, (B4 [lab] must be completed with either B2 or B3), B1-B5 elective, C1, C2, C3, C4, D1, D4, D5, and F. C4, D5, and F should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). One (1) course must be completed from B1, in addition to STAT 217. No SOC class may be taken to fulfill GE D5. Refer to online catalog for GE course selection and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

Any Sociology Elective (300-400 level) can go here. Refer to catalog for course selections.

Any ICS Course can go here. 300-400 level courses selected in consultation with advising faculty. A written justification for the courses selected and the way they constitute a cohesive, integrated study is required. One-half of the units must be courses from the department.

If GE courses are taken for letter grade and used as concentration courses, additional free elective units may be required to complete the 180 unit total degree requirement. See college advisor for additional information.
